text: Aspergillus neocarnoyi is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Aspergillus section. The species was first described in 1989.Kozakiewicz, Z. 1989. Aspergillus species on the stored products. Mycological Papers. 161:1-188 It has been reported to produce asperentins, asperflavin, auroglaucin, a bisanthron, dihydroauroglaucin, echinulins, flavoglaucin, neoechinulins, questin, questinol, tetracyclic, and tetrahydroauroglaucin. ==Growth and morphology== A. neocarnoyi has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_neocarnoyi_cya.png|Aspergillus neocarnoyi growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_neocarnoyi_meaox.png|Aspergillus neocarnoyi growing on MEAOX plate == References == neocarnoyi Category:Fungi described in 1989
title: Aspergillus neocarnoyi
